description: Tawang town, Tawang district, Arunachal Pradesh
nearest_railway: Bhalukpong / Rangapara North / Tezpur (Assam) — approx. 270–330 km
accessibility: Mountain roads; not wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Local guides available
nearby_amenities: Hotels, guesthouses, restaurants, souvenir shops in Tawang town
special_notes: One of the largest Tibetan Buddhist monasteries in India; major seat of Mahayana Buddhism

description: On the Tezpur–Tawang highway (NH 13), between Tawang and Bomdila, Arunachal Pradesh
timings: Accessible in daytime; often blocked in winter
entry_fee: Not documented (ILP required for Arunachal entry)
accessibility: High-altitude pass (13,700 ft); steep, winding roads
guided_tours: Local drivers/guides from Tawang and Bomdila
nearby_amenities: Minimal facilities; better hotels and restaurants in Tawang & Bomdila
special_notes: Sacred to Buddhists; famous turquoise Sela Lake; strategic military post nearby

place_name: Nuranang Falls (Jang Falls / Bong Bong Falls)
description: Near Jang town, ~40 km from Tawang, Tawang District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Motoring road up to viewing area; short walk to base
guided_tours: Local guides sometimes available
nearby_amenities: Small shops and tea stalls in Jang; hotels & restaurants in Tawang
special_notes: Filming location of Bollywood song “Tanhai Tanhai” (Koyla); pristine, less crowded waterfall

description: Bomdila town, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Hill town; road access from Tezpur/Guwahati
guided_tours: Local guides available in Bomdila
nearby_amenities: Hotels, homestays, cafes, and shops in Bomdila town
special_notes: Known as “Gentse Gaden Rabgyel Lling” monastery; center for Lamaistic studies

description: Dirang town, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Good mountain road; motorable throughout
guided_tours: Local homestays often arrange guides
nearby_amenities: Resorts, homestays, local eateries, hot springs, shops
special_notes: Famous for hot water springs, apple orchards, kiwi farms

description: Ziro town, Lower Subansiri District, Arunachal Pradesh
nearest_airport: Lilabari Airport (Assam) ~130 km / Donyi Polo Airport ~120 km
accessibility: Roads motorable but winding
guided_tours: Available — local Apatani guides, cultural village walks
nearby_amenities: Resorts, homestays, restaurants, cafes, music festival grounds, shops
special_notes: UNESCO Tentative World Heritage Site; famous for Apatani tribal culture, paddy–fish farming

category: National Park / Wildlife Sanctuary / Tiger Reserve
description: Miao town region, Changlang District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Forest entry by road; treks inside range from easy to difficult
guided_tours: Mandatory entry with permits; forest guides & guards available
nearby_amenities: Forest rest houses, basic lodges, small eateries at Miao town
special_notes: Fourth-largest national park in India; only park with four big cats

description: Hilltop in Itanagar city, Papum Pare District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Within city; short climb uphill (stairs)
guided_tours: Local city guides available
nearby_amenities: Hotels, cafes, restaurants in Itanagar
special_notes: Yellow-roofed Buddhist Gompa; panoramic city views

description: On the banks of the Siang River, East Siang District, Arunachal Pradesh
nearest_airport: Pasighat Airport (domestic) ~5 km; Dibrugarh (major airport) ~150 km
accessibility: Well connected by road from Dibrugarh and Itanagar
guided_tours: Local guides for rafting, angling, village tours available
nearby_amenities: Hotels, eco-resorts, markets, restaurants, river camps
special_notes: Known as the “Gateway to Arunachal”; rafting hotspot

description: Remote high-altitude valley, Shi-Yomi District, Arunachal Pradesh
entry_fee: Not applicable (ILP required for Arunachal entry)
accessibility: Remote mountain roads; difficult but scenic drive
guided_tours: Local homestays & tourism dept. provide guides
nearby_amenities: Homestays, guesthouses, small eateries; limited shops
special_notes: Known for ancient Samten Yongcha Monastery, wooden hanging bridges

description: At the foothills of the Mishmi Hills, Lower Dibang Valley, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Good road via Assam
guided_tours: Local guides available for Mayodia Pass treks & tribal villages
nearby_amenities: Hotels, lodges, homestays, small restaurants
special_notes: Gateway to Mayodia Pass, Mehao Wildlife Sanctuary

category: River Valley Town / Tribal Culture Destination
description: On the banks of the Subansiri River, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Mountain roads; long winding routes
guided_tours: Available — local guides for trekking, tribal village tours
nearby_amenities: Basic hotels, shops, local eateries
special_notes: Known for bamboo suspension bridges, tribal culture of Tagin & Hill Miri tribes

description: 15 km from Dirang town, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Road from Dirang; motorable
guided_tours: Local birdwatching and trekking guides available
nearby_amenities: Homestays, eco-resorts, local restaurants
special_notes: Famous for black-necked cranes (migratory birds), apple & kiwi orchards

description: On the Brahmaputra (Lohit River) banks, Lohit District, Arunachal Pradesh
timings: Open all year; peak during Makar Sankranti (Jan)
accessibility: Road motorable up to kund; steps down to river
guided_tours: Pilgrimage organizers & local guides available
nearby_amenities: Guesthouses in Tezu, small stalls near kund
special_notes: Sacred Hindu pilgrimage; lakhs of devotees take a holy dip every January

place_name: Pangsau Pass & Lake of No Return
description: Indo–Myanmar border, near Nampong town, Changlang District, Arunachal Pradesh
entry_fee: Free (ILP required; special permits for border fair)
accessibility: Hill roads from Nampong; motorable but steep and winding
guided_tours: Available via tourism dept. during festival; local guides for WWII trail tours
nearby_amenities: Homestays & small eateries at Nampong
special_notes: Famous for WWII history (Stilwell Road); Lake of No Return associated with legends

category: Mountain Pass / Scenic Drive / Snow Destination
description: ~56 km from Roing town, Lower Dibang Valley District, Arunachal Pradesh
timings: Open all day (seasonal closures in heavy snow)
accessibility: Motorabale by road (NH13), winding roads with hairpin bends
guided_tours: Local guides from Roing available for snow treks
nearby_amenities: Rest houses in Roing; tea stalls on route
special_notes: Famous for snow in winter; scenic views of Dibang Valley

description: At the confluence of Siyom and Sipu rivers, West Siang District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Connected by road from Pasighat & Likabali
guided_tours: Available — local guides for tribal village tours
nearby_amenities: Hotels, homestays, markets, eateries
special_notes: Known for hanging bridges made of bamboo and cane

description: Dambuk town, Lower Dibang Valley District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Motorabale roads; last stretch slightly rough
guided_tours: Festival packages & local guides available
nearby_amenities: Festival camps, homestays, food stalls, adventure activity zones
special_notes: Combines adventure sports with indie/rock music; promotes local oranges & tribal culture

description: Chongkham town, Namsai District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Easily accessible by road; temple complex wheelchair-friendly in many parts
guided_tours: Available via local tourism offices
nearby_amenities: Hotels in Namsai, restaurants, meditation centers
special_notes: A Burmese-style temple built in 2010; important Theravada Buddhist pilgrimage

description: ~30 km from Ziro town, Lower Subansiri District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Trekking trails only
guided_tours: Compulsory with forest guides; trekking packages available
nearby_amenities: Homestays in Ziro; basic forest huts on trek
special_notes: Dense subtropical forests; endangered clouded leopards; UNESCO tentative heritage zone

description: Near Roing town, Lower Dibang Valley District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Motoring road up to fort site; moderate walking required
guided_tours: Local guides available at site
nearby_amenities: Lodges in Roing town, small shops near site
special_notes: 8th-century fort of Chutia dynasty; one of the oldest archaeological sites in Arunachal

description: Likabali town, Lower Siang District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Easily motorable; steps at temple site
guided_tours: Local temple guides available
nearby_amenities: Hotels in Likabali; local eateries & shops
special_notes: Archaeological site (8th–12th century); associated with Krishna–Rukmini legends

description: Tipi town, ~5 km from Bhalukpong, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
accessibility: Motoring road; wheelchair access limited inside greenhouses
guided_tours: Available; staff provide orchid information
nearby_amenities: Small shops nearby; hotels & eateries in Bhalukpong
special_notes: Houses over 1000 species of orchids; major research & conservation center
